result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendrick L Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court costs, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge to be collected from 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid by 5/10/18.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.

superMiscConds.notes: Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program and a parenting program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge. 
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kendrick L Walker in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 42 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS, concurrent to case #14CF2266 , credit for 2 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 5/10/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 5/10/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
-6 month drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Kendrick L Walker in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood. Marissa Santiago for Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 11/10/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Kendrick L Walker in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood. Stephan Nolten for Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense counsel is going to do a referral to drug treatment court for the defendant although there is currently a waiting list for the program. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 10/2/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 10/20/2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed. Joinder motion will be addressed at the final pretrial.

Defendant Kendrick L Walker in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for Nathaniel Adamson for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea.  Parties have been notified that effective August 3, 2014, this case is reassigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15, Room G-55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Plea hearing scheduled for 08-07-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kendrick L Walker in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense withdraws motion to suppress.  State has filed a motion to join case 14cf2266 and 14cf967 and other acts evidence.  Defense needs time to review discovery on the new case.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Addendum to State's Motion to Join and to Admit Other Acts Evidence and State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress received and filed./ds
State's Motion to Join and to Admit Other Acts Evidence received and filed./ds
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress received and filed./ds

Defendant Kendrick L Walker in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant has been arrested by officers from the HIDTA unit and will be charged with a new case.  Motions to be filed by 5-30-14; response/reply by 6-9-14.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kendrick L Walker in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kendrick L Walker in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Paul Hauer for Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mary Schmitz-MPD Detective. Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleadsnot guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-24-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kendrick L Walker in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Dax C. Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel's Motion to DISMISS the complaint was DENIED by the Court.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
